verbs.description: burke (third-person singular simple present burkes, present participle burking, simple past and past participle burked)

entries.meaning: (UK, Ireland, Australia, New Zealand, slang) To murder by suffocation.
examples: As soon as the executioner proceeded to his duty, the cries of ‘Burke him, Burke him—give him no rope’... were vociferated... ‘Burke Hare too!’

entries.meaning: (UK, Ireland, Australia, New Zealand, slang, historical) To murder for the same purpose as Burke, to kill in order to have a body to sell to anatomists, surgeons, etc.
examples: Perhaps he is Burked, and his body sold for nine pounds.

entries.meaning: (UK, Ireland, Australia, New Zealand, slang) To smother; to conceal, hush up, suppress.
examples: The reporters left it out... Those who spoke in favour of the poor men, were what the reporters call burked.
